name: scholar_bulk_search
description: Search multiple academic queries on Google Scholar in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling scholar_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string. Example: 'transformer attention mechanism,CRISPR gene editing,quantum computing'.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Comma-separated search queries (e.g. 'deep learning,natural language processing,computer vision')

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('.gs_r.gs_or.gs_scl'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const titleEl = el.querySelector('.gs_rt a'); const titleFallback = el.querySelector('.gs_rt'); const snippetEl = el.querySelector('.gs_rs'); const authorEl = el.querySelector('.gs_a'); const citedByEl = el.querySelector('.gs_fl a[href*="cites"]'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('.gs_rt a'); const pdfEl = el.querySelector('.gs_or_ggsm a, a[href*="pdf"]'); const yearMatch = authorEl ? authorEl.textContent.match(/(\d{4})/) : null; results.push({ title: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : (titleFallback ? titleFallback.textContent.trim() : ''), url: linkEl ? linkEl.href : '', pdf_url: pdfEl ? pdfEl.href : '', authors_info: authorEl ? authorEl.textContent.trim() : '', year: yearMatch ? yearMatch[1] : '', snippet: snippetEl ? snippetEl.textContent.trim().substring(0, 300) : '', cited_by: citedByEl ? citedByEl.textContent.trim() : '' }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { query: params.get('q') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
